1.description: The first step is to identify the problems. The initial step in assessing the social and human factors influencing requirements management in software ecosystems is to understand the day-to-day factors of professionals engaged in requirements management activities and to discover the contextual characteristics of requirements management. Ask team professionals which factors they have encountered, present the list of barriers that prevent professionals from dealing with social and human factors, and understand if they have encountered any in their requirements management activities in software ecosystems. Inquire about the improvement strategies and coping mechanisms professionals believe can be used to address social and human factors and overcome barriers. The tool allows feedback collection through a structured questionnaire in organizational research format and can also be used to collect feedback through unstructured methods (e.g., retrospectives, individual meetings). It is essential that this step be done individually.
1.title: Ask:

2.description: Improvement strategies should be implemented at both the individual team and organizational levels, contingent upon the identified social and human factors and barriers. Following feedback collection, responses ought to be analyzed to ascertain which barriers and social and human factors necessitate prioritization for enhancement. Strategies for improvement should be devised, and financial resources should be allocated for rectification if deemed necessary.
2.title: Plan:

3.description: Small, continuous, and iterative improvements are crucial. Gradually implement improvement strategies and evaluate whether they effectively address social and human factors and barriers. Monitoring the success of improvement strategies is essential for dealing with social and human factors and overcoming barriers. After planned improvements have been implemented, repeat this three-step process iteratively to sustain progress and address factors and barriers, thereby maintaining a process of continuous improvement.
